required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on October 07, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of COVID-19 on Personal Protection Among Dentist in Egypt
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of COVID-19 on Personal Protection Among Dentist in Egypt: A Quick Online Survey

brief_summary.textblock: Dentist exposed to coronavirus (COVID-19) may not have adequate access to personal protective equipment (PPE), safety procedures, and diagnostic protocols. Our objective will be to evaluate the reality and perceptions about personal safety among dentist in Egypt

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a cross-sectional, online survey-based study administered to Dentist in Egypt. A 20-item questionnaire will be developed and distributed using Google Forms.
Participants were recruited through social networking websites and applications (Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and WhatsApp). The questionnaire will be conducted from 24 May 2020 and until 30 june 2020.
The survey will be delivered in Enlish. Participants will be able to complete the survey only once and will be allowed to terminate the survey at any time they desired. The survey will be anonymous and confidential. An introductory paragraph outlining the purpose of the study will be posted along with the survey.

primary_outcome.description: measure the personal protection measures used among dentist during Covid-19 pandemic through online Survey

secondary_outcome.measure: impact of Covid-19 pandemic on type of face masks used in dental clinic
secondary_outcome.description: measure the personal protection measures used among dentist during Covid-19 pandemic through online Survey

intervention.description: a cross-sectional, online survey-based study administered to Dentist in Egypt. A 20-item questionnaire developed and distributed using Google Forms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
All dentist actively working in Egypt
Exclusion Criteria:
- non dentist
- resident outside egypt

reference.citation: Odeh ND, Babkair H, Abu-Hammad S, Borzangy S, Abu-Hammad A, Abu-Hammad O. COVID-19: Present and Future Challenges for Dental Practice. Int J Environ Res Public Health. 2020 Apr 30;17(9). pii: E3151. doi: 10.3390/ijerph17093151. Review.

Ather A, Patel B, Ruparel NB, Diogenes A, Hargreaves KM. Coronavirus Disease 19 (COVID-19): Implications for Clinical Dental Care. J Endod. 2020 May;46(5):584-595. doi: 10.1016/j.joen.2020.03.008. Epub 2020 Apr 6. Review.
Alharbi A, Alharbi S, Alqaidi S. Guidelines for dental care provision during the COVID-19 pandemic. Saudi Dent J. 2020 May;32(4):181-186. doi: 10.1016/j.sdentj.2020.04.001. Epub 2020 Apr 7.

responsible_party.investigator_title: associate professor in oral & maxillofacial Surgery Department
